title: path to ocs?
body: hey guys just want to know, that after oceanic open ladder removed, how to earn a spot in the ocs? any other paths to pro?

replies.body:
I remember Riot mentioning that they would be sponsoring certain amateur/semi-pro tournaments that would count as either qualifications for OCS or as official scouting grounds.

This would have been in their post on OCS/OPL/Academy at the end of last year.

Hope this helps :)
{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}
thanks heaps my friend, but any idea what tournaments may be counted as semi pro, or amateur tourneys :/

I believe Throwdown Esports and SumSocOCE Splits are some (as they are two of the biggest amateur/semi-pro tournaments), but can neither confirm nor deny, since the article didn't mention any specific ones.

There's also a couple of things run by Gfinity... But from what I've seen, a lot of it is just get to a high rank, watch the various team discords/Twitter feeds/posts on the forums for "looking for" posts. A lot of players get picked up just because they've been seen by other pros/semipros/high ranked players and they've gotten on friendly terms with them. But yeah, watch for posts and make friends
Doesn't scouting grounds exist in OCE?
